intro: Didymoglossum lorencei, commonly known as the Lorence's ghost moss, is a rare and delicate species of moss belonging to the family Dicranaceae. It is characterized by its slender, dark green stems and small, elongated leaves that are often curved. This plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as on the forest floor or in rocky crevices. Its reproductive structures, known as capsules, are borne on short stalks and release spores when mature. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Didymoglossum lorencei is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
